trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS in Objective C
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS in Objective C

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with analytics and push notifications for iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with analytics and push notifications for iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS apps in Objective C
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for iOS apps in Objective C

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: iOS | Obj C
trans-unit.target: iOS | Obj C

trans-unit.source: iOS | Swift
trans-unit.target: iOS | Swift

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: Cordova
trans-unit.target: Cordova

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users to an iOS application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users to an iOS application.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you create a blank iOS app that collects basic data and receives push notifications using Apple Push Notification System (APNS).
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you create a blank iOS app that collects basic data and receives push notifications using Apple Push Notification System (APNS).

trans-unit.source: When you have completed this tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target-specific users based on their devices properties.
trans-unit.target: When you have completed this tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target-specific users based on their devices properties.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: XCode, which you can install from your MAC App Store
trans-unit.target: XCode, which you can install from your MAC App Store

trans-unit.source: the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK]
trans-unit.target: the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK]

trans-unit.source: Push notification certificate (.p12) that you can obtain on your Apple Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Push notification certificate (.p12) that you can obtain on your Apple Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps, and to complete it, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for iOS apps, and to complete it, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: Set up Mobile Engagement for your app
trans-unit.target: Set up Mobile Engagement for your app

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure portal, and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure portal, and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Services**, click **Mobile Engagement**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Services**, click **Mobile Engagement**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up that appears, enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up that appears, enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Application Name**: Type the name of your application.
trans-unit.target: **Application Name**: Type the name of your application.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to use any character.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to use any character.

trans-unit.source: **Platform**: Select the target platform (**iOS**) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).
trans-unit.target: **Platform**: Select the target platform (**iOS**) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).

trans-unit.source: **Application Resource Name**: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.
trans-unit.target: **Application Resource Name**: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.

trans-unit.source: You must only use conventional URL characters.
trans-unit.target: You must only use conventional URL characters.

trans-unit.source: The auto-generated name should provide you a strong basis.
trans-unit.target: The auto-generated name should provide you a strong basis.

trans-unit.source: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash because this name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash because this name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: **Location**: Select the datacenter where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: **Location**: Select the datacenter where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: **Collection**: If you have already created an application, select a previously created **Collection**; otherwise select **New Collection**.
trans-unit.target: **Collection**: If you have already created an application, select a previously created **Collection**; otherwise select **New Collection**.

trans-unit.source: **Collection Name**: This represents your group of applications.
trans-unit.target: **Collection Name**: This represents your group of applications.

trans-unit.source: It also ensures that all your apps are in a group that allows aggregated calculations of metrics.
trans-unit.target: It also ensures that all your apps are in a group that allows aggregated calculations of metrics.

trans-unit.source: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.
trans-unit.target: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.

trans-unit.source: Select the app you just created in the **Applications** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the app you just created in the **Applications** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connection Info** in order to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connection Info** in order to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Connection String** - This is what you will need to identify this app in your Application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your phone app.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Connection String** - This is what you will need to identify this app in your Application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your phone app.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: This tutorial presents a "basic integration", which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial presents a "basic integration", which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.

trans-unit.source: The complete integration documentation can be found in the Mobile Engagement iOS SDK documentation.
trans-unit.target: The complete integration documentation can be found in the Mobile Engagement iOS SDK documentation.

trans-unit.source: We will create a basic app with XCode to demonstrate the integration.
trans-unit.target: We will create a basic app with XCode to demonstrate the integration.

trans-unit.source: Create a new iOS project
trans-unit.target: Create a new iOS project

trans-unit.source: You can skip this step if you already have an app and are familiar with iOS development.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this step if you already have an app and are familiar with iOS development.

trans-unit.source: Start Xcode and in the pop-up, select **Create a new Xcode project**.
trans-unit.target: Start Xcode and in the pop-up, select **Create a new Xcode project**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Single View Application**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Single View Application**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the **Product Name**, **Organization Name**, and **Organization Identifier**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the **Product Name**, **Organization Name**, and **Organization Identifier**.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have selected **Objective-C** in the **Language** box.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have selected **Objective-C** in the **Language** box.

trans-unit.source: Xcode will create the demo app into which we integrate Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: Xcode will create the demo app into which we integrate Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: Download the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK].
trans-unit.target: Download the [Mobile Engagement iOS SDK].

trans-unit.source: Extract the .tar.gz file to a folder in your computer.
trans-unit.target: Extract the .tar.gz file to a folder in your computer.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project, and then select **Add files to**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project, and then select **Add files to**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK, select the `EngagementSDK` folder, and then press **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK, select the `EngagementSDK` folder, and then press **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Build Phases** tab, and in the **Link Binary With Libraries** menu, add the frameworks as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Open the **Build Phases** tab, and in the **Link Binary With Libraries** menu, add the frameworks as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Go back to the Azure portal in your app's **Connection Info** page and copy the connection string.
trans-unit.target: Go back to the Azure portal in your app's **Connection Info** page and copy the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Open your your Application Delegate implementation file and add the following line of code.
trans-unit.target: Open your your Application Delegate implementation file and add the following line of code.

trans-unit.source: Now paste the connection string in the `didFinishLaunchingWithOptions` delegate.
trans-unit.target: Now paste the connection string in the `didFinishLaunchingWithOptions` delegate.

trans-unit.source: Enable real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: Enable real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: In order to start sending data and ensuring that the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.
trans-unit.target: In order to start sending data and ensuring that the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.

trans-unit.source: Open the **ViewController.h** file, import **EngagementViewController.h**, and replace the super class of the **ViewController** interface by **EngagementViewController**, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Open the **ViewController.h** file, import **EngagementViewController.h**, and replace the super class of the **ViewController** interface by **EngagementViewController**, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Ensure your app is connected with real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: Ensure your app is connected with real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using the Mobile Engagement real-time monitoring feature.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using the Mobile Engagement real-time monitoring feature.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal

trans-unit.source: From your Azure portal, ensure that you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom:
trans-unit.target: From your Azure portal, ensure that you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom:

trans-unit.source: You will land in the **Settings** page in your Engagement portal for your app.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the **Settings** page in your Engagement portal for your app.

trans-unit.source: From there, click the **Monitor** tab:
trans-unit.target: From there, click the **Monitor** tab:

trans-unit.source: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in real time, that will start your app:
trans-unit.target: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in real time, that will start your app:

trans-unit.source: Back in Xcode, start your app either in the simulator or in a connected device.
trans-unit.target: Back in Xcode, start your app either in the simulator or in a connected device.

trans-unit.source: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor!
trans-unit.target: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor!

trans-unit.source: **Congratulations!** You succeeded in the first step of this tutorial and have an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend and is already sending data.
trans-unit.target: **Congratulations!** You succeeded in the first step of this tutorial and have an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend and is already sending data.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Home** button of the simulator to bring back the number of sessions in the monitor to 0 as shown above.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Home** button of the simulator to bring back the number of sessions in the monitor to 0 as shown above.

trans-unit.source: Enable push notifications and in-app messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable push notifications and in-app messaging

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact with your users and REACH with push notifications and in-app messaging in the context of campaigns.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact with your users and REACH with push notifications and in-app messaging in the context of campaigns.

trans-unit.source: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: The following sections set up your app to receive them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections set up your app to receive them.

trans-unit.source: Enable your app to receive Silent Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable your app to receive Silent Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Add the Reach library to your project
trans-unit.target: Add the Reach library to your project

trans-unit.source: Right-click your project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click your project.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add file to**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add file to**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder where you extracted the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Select the `EngagementReach` folder.
trans-unit.target: Select the `EngagementReach` folder.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Modify your Application Delegate
trans-unit.target: Modify your Application Delegate

trans-unit.source: At the top of your implementation file, import the Engagement Reach module.
trans-unit.target: At the top of your implementation file, import the Engagement Reach module.

trans-unit.source: Inside the **application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions** method, create a Reach module and pass it to your existing Engagement initialization line:
trans-unit.target: Inside the **application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions** method, create a Reach module and pass it to your existing Engagement initialization line:

trans-unit.source: Enable your app to receive APNS Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable your app to receive APNS Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Add the following line to the **application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions** method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following line to the **application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions** method:

trans-unit.source: Add the **application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken** method as follows:
trans-unit.target: Add the **application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken** method as follows:

trans-unit.source: Add the **didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler** method as follows:
trans-unit.target: Add the **didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler** method as follows:

trans-unit.source: Grant Mobile Engagement access to your push certificate
trans-unit.target: Grant Mobile Engagement access to your push certificate

trans-unit.source: To allow Mobile Engagement to send push notifications on your behalf, you need to grant it access to your certificate.
trans-unit.target: To allow Mobile Engagement to send push notifications on your behalf, you need to grant it access to your certificate.

trans-unit.source: This is done by configuring and entering your certificate into the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This is done by configuring and entering your certificate into the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you obtain your .p12 certificate as explained in the Apple documentation.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you obtain your .p12 certificate as explained in the Apple documentation.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Ensure you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom:
trans-unit.target: Ensure you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom:

trans-unit.source: You will land in the **Settings** page in your Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the **Settings** page in your Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: From there, click the **Native Push** section to upload your p12 certificate:
trans-unit.target: From there, click the **Native Push** section to upload your p12 certificate:

trans-unit.source: Select your p12, upload it, and then type your password:
trans-unit.target: Select your p12, upload it, and then type your password:

trans-unit.source: Now add your provisioning profile and build your app for a target device.
trans-unit.target: Now add your provisioning profile and build your app for a target device.

trans-unit.source: You're all set.
trans-unit.target: You're all set.

trans-unit.source: Now we will verify that you have correctly carried out this basic integration.
trans-unit.target: Now we will verify that you have correctly carried out this basic integration.

trans-unit.source: Send a notification to your app
trans-unit.target: Send a notification to your app

trans-unit.source: We will now create a simple push notification campaign that will send a push to our app:
trans-unit.target: We will now create a simple push notification campaign that will send a push to our app:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Reach** tab in your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Reach** tab in your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **New Announcement** to create your push notification campaign.
trans-unit.target: Click **New Announcement** to create your push notification campaign.

trans-unit.source: Set up the first field of your campaign:
trans-unit.target: Set up the first field of your campaign:

trans-unit.source: Name your campaign with any name you like.
trans-unit.target: Name your campaign with any name you like.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Delivery time** as **Out of app only**: this is the simple Apple push notification type that features some text.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Delivery time** as **Out of app only**: this is the simple Apple push notification type that features some text.

trans-unit.source: In the Notification text, type first the title which will be the first line in the push.
trans-unit.target: In the Notification text, type first the title which will be the first line in the push.

trans-unit.source: Then type your message which will be the second line.
trans-unit.target: Then type your message which will be the second line.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down, and in the **Content** section, select "Notification only".
trans-unit.target: Scroll down, and in the **Content** section, select "Notification only".

trans-unit.source: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible.
trans-unit.target: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible.

trans-unit.source: Now scroll down again, and then create your campaign to save it!
trans-unit.target: Now scroll down again, and then create your campaign to save it!

trans-unit.source: Last step: Activate your campaign.
trans-unit.target: Last step: Activate your campaign.

trans-unit.source: You should see a push notification in your device!
trans-unit.target: You should see a push notification in your device!

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
